alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 7:40PM MDT until June 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River NEAR Avondale affecting Pueblo County. Fountain Creek Near Fountain affecting El Paso County. Fountain Creek Near Pinon affecting Pueblo County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. .Heavy rainfall expected overnight will cause the Fountain Creek and the Arkansas River at Avondale to rise above flood stage later tonight through tomorrow morning. The degree of flooding will depend highly on the amount of rain and where it falls. The forecasts below could change if heavier rainfall occurs. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Avondale...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Arkansas River NEAR Avondale. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor Flood. Minor lowland flooding occurs near Avondale * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to 7.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning to 6.6 feet Sunday evening. It will rise to 6.7 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.8 feet on 04/24/1942. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 745 AM MDT.
